title: jtx71
author: jtx71
content: Hi.I'd like help with a tx that has been unconfirmed for several days.On an automatic response from the devs it says I can increase the fee with: transaction  > options > raise fee.But I cant find this options whithin the app. When I select the tx the only 2 options available are "report issue" and "browse".I use the lastest version of the wallet.Do you know how I can raise fee (RBF) whitin the Bitcoin Android Wallet?Thank you very much!

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: jtx71 on March 16, 2023, 01:29:08 PMI dont know if this matters but the coins were transmitted and I can see them in another wallet, but the tx remains unconfirmed. On the other wallet I have the options to broadcast (that doesnt work) or to remove the tx. If I click on "remove", will the tx be rejected and coins appear again in the original wallet? or just it is removed from the tx list?Thx for ur answer!Yes, it always reflect on the receiving wallet's balance but labeled as "receiving" or "incoming" when the wallet detects any incoming transactions.If there's a "remove" or cancel feature then that would be much better to cancel it as the sent coins will return to the original wallet and you can send it again with higher tx fees for faster confirmation.Also, i will also recommend like mentioned above to use electrum or mycelium if you are a regular android user for security and safety reasons than this wallet you currently using.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: jtx71 on March 16, 2023, 01:29:08 PMI dont know if this matters but the coins were transmitted and I can see them in another wallet, but the tx remains unconfirmed. Yes, you can see the unconfirmed transaction because it is active in the mempool and self-custodial wallets generally show them to you (unlike exchanges who only show your balance after few confirmations).Quote from: PX-Z on March 16, 2023, 01:44:52 PMIf there's a "remove" or cancel feature then that would be much better to cancel it as the sent coins will return to the original wallet and you can send it again with higher tx fees for faster confirmation.I don't think there's any feature that can "cancel" your bitcoin transaction once sent. Maybe that option will just remove the tx from his wallet but it will be still active in the network and will show back again into his wallet after it is confirmed.Quote from: PX-Z on March 16, 2023, 01:44:52 PMAlso, i will also recommend like mentioned above to use electrum or mycelium if you are a regular android user for security and safety reasons than this wallet you currently using.Electrum is not a mobile friendly wallet. I wouldn't suggest that. Mycelium is okay. And you are forgetting the most popular one of these days which is bluewallet.

comments.author: jtx71
comments.body: Hi.I removed the tx from the receiving wallet and disappeared from the list. Coins disappeared too, but they did not appear in the original wallet, although by checking the address on an explorer the coins never moved. I guess I'll have to wait for the network to confirm or reject the tx. Hope it doesnt take long. I'll get back with an update when some of this happens.Thank u for helping!

I'll get back with an update when some of this happens.Thank u for helping!Just as expected, the coins just disappeared from your wallet but it can't be removed from the explorer just by yourself. Btw, can you tell for how long your tx is pending ? An unconfirmed transaction can remain on the mempool for 14days before getting dropped back (meaning sent back to the original sender's wallet). And how much fee size in sats per vByte did you pay? That can give us an idea to help you with the rough estimate.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: jtx71 on March 16, 2023, 03:12:10 PMI made the tx last Friday (March 10th), but it did not transmit until next day. So the tx remains unconfirmed since Saturday (5 days so far).Thats quite a long time already. I hope you don't try to rebroadcast your transaction now since there's no use in doing so. Let it drop off the network automatically by next week.Quote from: jtx71 on March 16, 2023, 03:12:10 PMDont know the sats per byte since if I check the tx it doesnt appear on the explorer.You can see the fee rate of your tx on mempool. Just go to "mempool.space/tx/<your tx id>" and you will get a fee rate column under your transaction. You can also check the average fee rate (in sat/vB) on top of the mempool to get an idea on how much fee is required to get your tx confirmed faster next time
